results.title: Mohammad Reza Pahlavi: politics of oil
results.creator_credit: Nielsen-Ferns, New York Times Productions and Jeremy Murray-Brown
results.brief_description: Examines the rise and fall of the Shah of Iran, highlighting his position as a puppet in the hands of the great powers after World War II. Shows the role played by the CIA in Iran’s internal problems; the role of the Shah’s security service in suppressing all those considered disloyal; the oil boom; the promotion of Western values; the fortune amassed by the Shah’s family while the majority of the Iranians remained poor; and the revolt against the Shah led by the Ayatollah Khomeini. Narrated by Henry Fonda Suitable for upper secondary level
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nielsen-Ferns, New York Times Productions and Jeremy Murray-Brown

results.title: Modern weather theory. Part 2. Structure of storms
results.brief_description: This film uses animation and maps to explain normal weather conditions and the atmosphere that creates the prevailing winds. Maps and diagrams also show the zones of the prevailing westerlies, and trade winds, and the way in which warm moist air rises, cools by expansion, loses its moisture by precipitation, and so on.

results.title: Modern Wales
results.creator_credit: James Carr, World Wide Pictures and Peter Hopkinson
results.brief_description: The fluctuating world demand for the wealth which lay beneath the lovely valleys of Wales - her iron, steel and coal - brought severe economic depression. As a consequence, Welsh industry was re-orientated so that it would never again rely on a few basic products.

results.title: Modern town rises from desert - Whyalla
results.brief_description: Whyalla in South Australia, showing aspects of its community life and describing its important industries. Blasting of iron ore, the production of iron and the extensive ship building industry.

results.title: Modern surgery
results.creator_credit: March of Time, Inc. and Time-Life Films
results.brief_description: Discusses the resources and techniques of the modern hospital. Follows the case history of Mrs Conrad whose urgent need of an operation was a cause of consternation and fear. She receives advice and assurance from her family physician, enters hospital and finds herself in skilled hands.

results.title: Modern life: choices and conflicts
results.creator_credit: Nick Bosustow, Stephen Bosustow Productions and Charlie O. Hayward
results.brief_description: In four short situations this film examines a paradox of modern life; our increased knowledge about all phases of the universe except ourselves. In the first, a Wiggleman discouraged by one light switch which does not respond to him discovers a number of possible switches yet to be tried; in the second two figures choose togetherness in preference to separateness when their game on a teeter-totter doesn’t “work”; the third depicts two Wiggleman maintaining a difficult course over an obstructed road because of their optimism and the fourth portrays a figure who, undecided about all the possibilities open to him, grabs at them all only to become frustrated and confused.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nick Bosustow, Stephen Bosustow Productions and Charlie O. Hayward
